intro: Bifrenaria charlesworthii, commonly known as the Charlesworth's bifrenaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in flat-topped umbels. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
